TopicTitle: Suggested rule for Thread in the Add-ons on this site.

Articles.Content:
I suggest that it is obligatory to include the date of the last version of the Add-On (Mod / Plug-In / Parts) in the title of the thread.
Most threads have only the version, having no reference to the day it was updated. This makes it difficult to view and search for new versions of mods, considering most users do not have to write down or memorize all versions of installed mods.


PS: If this post is in the wrong place, please move it.

While it would be a handy addition, modders should not be required to say so in the title of the thread. Most modders include a changelog or say the most recent update date in the actual thread, if one looks closely enough. Even if not, modders are not required to cater to those who download the mods. There isn't a truly good reason for having such a rule, even if it would be easy to implement. 

Also, moved to Kerbal Network.
